intro: Siphocampylus albus, commonly known as the white siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in native plant gardens.
